verses.roman:
'nimāñi' nāma chāḍi' ebe bolāya 'gaurahari'
hindura dharma naṣṭa kaila pāṣaṇḍa sañcāri'

synonyms: nimāñi—Nimāi; nāma—the name; chāḍi'-giving up; ebe—now; bolāya—calls; gaurahari—Gaurahari; hindura—of the Hindus; dharma—the religious principles; naṣṭa kaila—spoiled; pāṣaṇḍa—irreligion; sañcāri'-introducing.
translation: " 'Now He has given up His own name Nimāi and introduced Himself by the name Gaurahari. He has spoiled the Hindu religious principles and introduced the irreligion of nonbelievers.
